contextId.information: Peter speaks of God's word as if it were alive forever. In reality, it is God who lives forever, and whose commands and promises last eternally. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: through the living and remaining word of God

contextId.information: Here the word "soul" refers to a person's spiritual life. Peter speaks of sinful desires as soldiers that are trying to destroy the spiritual life of believers. AT: "seek to destroy your spiritual life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here "carried our sins" means that he suffered the punishment for sins. AT: "suffered the punishment for our sins in his body on the tree" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: carried our sins in his body to the tree

contextId.information: Here "the word" refers to the gospel message. To disobey means that they do not believe. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:1pe:02:07|2:8]]. AT: "some men do not believe the message about Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: some men are disobedient to the word

contextId.information: Here the words "inner person" and "heart" refer to the inward character and personality of a person. AT: "what you really are on the inside" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: the inner person of the heart

contextId.information: "I have written about the true grace of God." Here the word "grace" refers to the gospel message, which tells of the kind things that God has done for believers. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: what I have written is the true grace of God
